lines.gurmukhi: 1 mMglwcrx- siqgur
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: saudw iekqu hit hY pIrwN pIru gurwN guru pUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Saudaa Ikatu Hati Hai Peeraan Peeru Guraan Guru Pooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Merchandise (of truth) is available only at that centre wherein sits the pit of the pits and the perfect Guru of the gurus.

lines.gurmukhi: piqq auDwrxu duK hrxu Asrxu srix vcn dw sUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Patit Udhaaranu Doukh Haranu Asaranu Sarani Vachan Daa Sooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is saviour of the fallen, dispeller of sufferings, and shelter of the shelterless.

lines.gurmukhi: Aaugux lY gux ivkxY suK swgru ivsrwie ivsUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Aougan Lai Goun Vikanai Soukh Saagaru Visaraai Visooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He takes away our demerits and bestows virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: kot ivkwr hjwr lK praupkwrI sdw hjUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Kati Vikaar Hajaar Lakh Paraoupakaaree Sadaa Hajooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Instead, ocean of delights, the Lord makes us forget grief and disappointment.

lines.gurmukhi: siqnwmu krqw purKu siq srUpu n kdhI aUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Satinaamu Karataa Purakhu Sati Saroopu N Kadahee Ooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He, the decimater of lacs of evils, is benevolent and ever present. He whose name is Truth, creator Lord, the truth form, never becomes incomplete i.e. He is ever complete.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scKMf vis Anhd sbd vjwey qUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sach Khand Vasi Anahad Sabad Vajaaay Tooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Residing in the holy congregation, the abode of truth,

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau kry ckcUrw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Karay Chakachooraa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: He blows the trumpet of unstruck melody and shatters the sense of duality.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 swD sMgq

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs praupkwr kir jwq n Ast Dwqu vIcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Paraoupakaar Kari Jaat N Asat Dhaatu Veechaarai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The philosopher's stone when showering benevolence (of making gold)

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn cMdn boihNdw APl sPl n jugiq aur Dwry
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Chandan Bohidaa Aphal Saphalu N Jougati Ur Dhaarai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Does not take into consideration the kind, and caste of the eight metals (alloy).

lines.gurmukhi: sB qy ieMdr vrsdw QwauN kuQwauN n AMmiRq Dwry
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Tay Indar Varasadaa Daaoun Kudaaoun N Anmrit Dhaarai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sandal makes all trees fragrant and their fruitlessness and fruitfulness never occurs to its mind.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj joiq audoq kir Eq poiq ho ikrx pswry
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Joti Udot Kari Aotapoti Ho Kiran Pasaarai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sun rises and spreads its rays equally at all the places.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI AMdir shn sIl prml hrY Avgux n icqwry
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Andari Sahan Seel Par Mal Harai Avagoun N Chitaarai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tolerance is the virtue of earth which accepts the refuse of others and never beholds their demerits.

lines.gurmukhi: lwl jvwhr mix lohw suienw pwrs jwiq ibcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Laal Javaahar Mani Lohaa Suinaa Paaras Jaati Bichaarai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, jewels, rubies, pearls, iron, philosopher's stone, gold etc. preserve their innate nature.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq kw AMqu n pwry ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Kaa Antu N Paarai ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: No limits are there of (the benevolence of) the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 siqgur syvw- sB PldwqI

Shabad OS B.translation: Service to the true Guru provides all fruits -

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs Dwiq kMcn krY hoie mnUr n kMcn JUrY
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Dhaati Kanchanu Karai Hoi Manoor N Kanchan Jhoorai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Philosopher's stone transforms metal into gold but the dross of iron does not become gold and is hence disappointed.

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn bohY bnwspiq bwNs ingMD n buhY hjUrY
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Bohai Banaasapati Baansu Nigandh N Buhai Hajoorai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sandalwood makes the whole vegetation fragrant but the nearby bamboo remains devoid of fragrance.

lines.gurmukhi: KyqI jMmY shs gux klr Kyiq n bIj augUrY
lines.transliteration_english: Khaytee Janmai Sahans Goun Kalar Khayti N Beej Angooray.

Shabad OS B.translation: On sowing seed, the earth produces thousand times more but in the alkaline soil the seed does not germinate.

lines.gurmukhi: aulU suJ n suJeI siqguru suJ suJwie hjUrY
lines.transliteration_english: Uloo Sujh N Sujhaee Satiguru Sujh Sujhaai Hajooray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The owl cannot see (the sun) but the true Guru bestowing the understanding about that Lord makes one see Him really and clearly.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI bIjY so luxY siqguru syvw sB Pl cUrY
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Beejai Su Lounai Satiguru Sayvaa Sabh Phal Choorai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only that which is sown in the earth is reaped but by serving the true Guru all sorts of fruits are attained.

lines.gurmukhi: boihQ pvY su inklY siqguru swDu AswDu n dUrY
lines.transliteration_english: Bohid Pavai So Nikalai Satiguru Saadhu Asaadhu N Doorai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As whoever boards the ship gets across, similarly the true Guru makes no distinction between the virtuous

lines.gurmukhi: psU pryqhuN dyv ivcUrY ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Pasoo Paraytahu Dayv Vichoorai ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: And the wicked and makes even animals and ghosts follow a godly life.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 siqgur sRyStqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Greatness of the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: kMcn hovy pwrshuN kMcn krY n kMcn horI
lines.transliteration_english: Kanchanu Hovai Paarasahu Kanchan Karai N Kanchan Horee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gold is made by the (touch of the) philosopher's stone but gold itself cannot produce gold.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn bwvn cMdnhuN EdUM horu n pvY krorI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Baavan Chandanahu Aodoon Horu N Pavai Karoree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sandal tree makes other tree fragrant but the latter cannot further make other trees fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: vuTY jMmY bIijAw siqguru miq icqvY Pl BorI
lines.transliteration_english: Voutdai Janmai Beejiaa Satiguru Mati Chitavai Phal Bhoree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sown seed sprouts only after it rains but adopting the teachings of the Guru, one attain fruit instantly.

lines.gurmukhi: rwiq pvY idhu AwQvY siqguru guru pUrx Dur DorI
lines.transliteration_english: Raati Pavai Dihu Aadavai Satiguru Guru Pooran Dhur Dhoree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sun sets at the fall of night but the perfect Guru is there all the time.

lines.gurmukhi: boihQ prbq nw cVHY siqguru hT ingHu n lhorI
lines.transliteration_english: Bohid Parabat Naa Charhhai Satiguru Hatd Nigrahu N Sahoree.

Shabad OS B.translation: As a ship cannot mount the mountain forcibly similarly, forced control over the senses is not liked by the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI no BuMcwl fr gurumiq inhcl clY n corI
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee No Bhounchaal Dar Guru Mati Nihachal Chalai N Choree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The earth may be scared of a quake and it becomes restive in its place but the Gurmat, Guru's tenets are steadfast and unconcealed.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur rqn pdwrQ borI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Ratan Padaarad Boree ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru, in fact, is a bag full of jewels.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 swD sMgq qoN bilhwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Sacrifice unto holy congregation

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj ciVAY jwin luk aulU AMD kMD jg mwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Charhiai Louk Jaani Uloo Andh Kandh Jagi Maahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: On sun-rise, the owls blind like wall hide themselves in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: buky isMG auidAwn mih jMbuk imrg n Kojy pwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Boukay Singh Udiaan Mahi Janbouk Mirag N Khojay Paahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the lion roars in the jungle, the jackals, deer etc. are not found around.

lines.gurmukhi: cViHAw cMd Akws qy ivic kunwlI lukY nwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Charhhiaa Chand Akaas Tay Vichi Kounaalee Loukai Naahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Moon in the sky cannot be concealed behind a small plate.

lines.gurmukhi: pMKI jyqy bn ibKY ifTy bwj n Tauir rhwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Pankhee Jaytay Ban Bikhai Ditday Baaj N Tdauri Rahaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing a hawk all the birds in the forest leave their places and become restive (and flutter for their safety).

lines.gurmukhi: cor jwr hrwmKor idhu cViHAw ko idsY nwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Chor Jaar Haraamakhor Dihu Charhhiaa Ko Disai Naahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thieves, adulterers and corrupt ones are not seen around after day break.

lines.gurmukhi: ijn ky irdY igAwn hoie lK AigAwnI suD krwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Jin Kay Ridai Giaan Hoi Lakh Agiaanee Sudh Karaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those, who have knowledge in their heart improve the intellect of lacs of ignorants.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq kY drsnY kil klyis sB ibns ibnwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Kai Darasanai Kali Kalaysi Sabh Binas Binaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glimpse of the holy congregation decimates all the tensions suffered in the kaliyug, the dark age.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivthu bil jwhI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Vitahu Bali Jaahee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto the holy congrega­tion.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 swDsMg DMn hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Blest is the holy congregation

lines.gurmukhi: rwiq hnHyrI cmkdy lK kroVI AMbir qwry
lines.transliteration_english: Raati Hanhayree Chamakaday Lakh Karorhee Anbari Taaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The lacs of stars shine in the dark night but with the moon rise they become dim.

lines.gurmukhi: cViHAY cMd mlIx hoie ko lukY ko bukY bbwry
lines.transliteration_english: Charhhiai Chand Maleen Honi Ko Loukai Ko Boukai Babaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Some of them go in hiding while some continue to twinkle.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj joiq audoq kir qwry cMd n rYx AMDwry
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Joti Udoti Kari Taaray Chand N Raini Andhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the sun rise, the stars, the moon and the dark night, all vanish.

lines.gurmukhi: dyvI dyv n sYvkwN qMq n mMq n Purn ivcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvee Dayv N Sayvakaan Tant N Mant N Dhurani Vichaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Before the servants, accomplished through the word of the true Guru, four vamas and four ashrams (astclhätu), the Vedas, Katebas are negligible

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqybwN Ast Dwq pUrY siqguru sbd svwry
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Katayb N Asat Dhaatu Pooray Satiguru Sabad Savaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: And the idea about gods, goddesses, their servants, tantra, mantra etc. does not even occur in the mind.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQ suhwvVw DMn gurU DMn gurU ipAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pand Suhaavarhaa Dhann Guroo Dhannu Guroo Piaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of gurmukhs is delightful. Blest is the Guru and also blessed are his beloved ones.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq prgtu sMswry ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Paragatu Sansaaray ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: The glory of the holy congregation is manifest in the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 siqgur dy gwhk

Shabad OS B.translation: Seekers of the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrn cwir mjhbwN iCA drsn vrqn vrqwry
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varani Chaari Majahabaan Chhia Darasan Varatani Varataaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the four vamas, four sects (of Muslims), six philosophies and their con­ducts,

lines.gurmukhi: ds Avqwr hjwr nwv Qwn mukwm sBy vxjwry
lines.transliteration_english: Das Avataar Hajaar Naav Daan Moukaam Sabhay Vanajaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ten incarnations, thousands of names of the Lord and all holy seats are His travelling traders.

lines.gurmukhi: iekqu hthuN vxj lY dys idsMqir krin pswry
lines.transliteration_english: Ikatu Hatahu Vanaj Lai Days Disantari Karani Pasaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having taken commodities from the store of that supreme reality, they spread them far and wide in the country and beyond.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru pUrw swhu hY byprvwhu AQwh BMfwry
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Pooraa Saahu Hai Bayparavaahu Adaahu Bhandaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: That carefree true Guru (Lord) is their perfect banker and His warehouses are unfathomable (and never ending).

lines.gurmukhi: lY lY mukr pwin sB siqguru dyie n dyNdw hwry
lines.transliteration_english: Lai Lai Moukari Paani Sabh Satiguru Dayi N Dayndaa Haaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: All take from Him and disavow but He, the true Guru, never gets tired bestowing gifts.

lines.gurmukhi: ieku kvwau pswau kir EAMkwr Akwr svwry
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Akaar Savaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: That Oankar Lord, extending His one vibrational sound, creates one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm siqguru bilhwry ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabraham Satigur Balihaaray ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto this trancendental Brahm in the form of true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 ibnw gurU giq nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: No liberation without Guru

lines.gurmukhi: pIr pYkMbr AOlIey gOs kuqb aulmwau Gnyry
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Paikanbar Auleeay Gaous Koutab Ulamaau Ghanayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the pirs, prophets, auliyas, gauris, qutubs and ulemas (all spiritual designations among Muslims).

lines.gurmukhi: syK mswiek swdkw suhdy AOru shId bhuqyry
lines.transliteration_english: Saykh Masaaik Saadakaa Suhaday Aur Saheed Bahoutayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many shaikhs, sadiks(contented ones), and martyrs are there. Many are Qazis mullahs, maulavis (all Muslim religious and judicial designations).

lines.gurmukhi: kwjI mulwN maulvI muPqI dwnsvMd bMdyry
lines.transliteration_english: Kaajee Mulaan Maulavee Mudhatee Daanasavand Bandayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: (Similarly among the Hindus) Rsis, munis, Jain Digambars (Jain naked ascetics) and many miracle-makers knowing black magic are also known in this world.

lines.gurmukhi: irKI munI idgMbrw kwlK krwmwq Aglyry
lines.transliteration_english: Rikhee Mounee Diganbaraan Kaalakh Karaamaat Agalayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Innumerable are the practising, siddhs (yogis) who publicise themselves as great persons.

lines.gurmukhi: swDk isD Agxq hYin Awp jxwiein vfy vfyry
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhik Sidhi Aganat Haini Aap Janaaini Vaday Vadayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: None gets liberated without the true Guru without whom their ego goes on increasing further,

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu gur koie n isJeI haumY vDdI jwie vDyry
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Gur Koi N Sijhaee Haoumain Vadhadee Jaai Vadhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without holy congregation, the sense of ego stares at the jtv menacingly,

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ibnu haumY hyry ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Binu Haoumai Hayray ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto this trancendental Brahm in the form of true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 haumY -EAMkwr

Shabad OS B.translation: All gifts are with the grace of Oankaar, the Lord -

lines.gurmukhi: iksY iriD isiD iksY dyie iksY iniD krwmwq su iksY
lines.transliteration_english: Kisai Ridhi Sidhi Kisai Dayi Kisai Nidhi Karaamaat Su Kisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Upon some He bestows miraculous powers (riddhis, siddhis) and to some He gives wealth and to some other miracles.

lines.gurmukhi: iksY rswiex iksY mix ikis pwrs iksY AMmiRq irsY
lines.transliteration_english: Kisai Rasaain Kisai Mani Kisai Paaras Kisai Anmrit Risai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To some He gives life-elixir, to some the fabulous gem, to some the philosopher's stone and due to His grace in the inner self of some trickles the nectar;

lines.gurmukhi: qMqu mMqu pwKMf iksY vIrwrwD idsMqru idsY
lines.transliteration_english: Tantu Mantu Paakhand Kisai Veeraaraadh Disantaru Disai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Some in His will practise tantra mantra hypocrisies and worship of Vas (S aivite worship) and some others He causes to wander in far off places.

lines.gurmukhi: iksY kwmDynu pwirjwq iksY lKmI dyvY ijsY
lines.transliteration_english: Kisai Kaamadhaynu Paarijaat Kisai Lakhamee Dayvai Jisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Upon some He bestows the wishfulfilling cow, upon some the wishfulfilling tree and on whomsoever He likes He bestows Laksami (goddess of wealth).

lines.gurmukhi: nwtk cytk Awsxw invlI krm Brm Bau imsY
lines.transliteration_english: Naatak Chaytak Aasanaa Nivalee Karam Bharam Bhau Misai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To delude many, He gives asans (postures), niolf kannas --the yogic exercises, and miracles and dramatic activities to many a person.

lines.gurmukhi: jogI BogI jogu Bogu sdw sMjogu ivjogu silsY
lines.transliteration_english: Jogee Bhogee Jogu Bhogu Sadaa Sanjogu Vijogu Salisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He gives asceticism to yogis and luxuries to bhogis (enjoyers of the wordly pleasures).

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwr su iqsY ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaari Akaar Su Tisai ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting and parting i.e. taking birth and dying always cojointly exist. These all are (various) forms of Oankar.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 mwxs jnmoqmqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Excellence of human birth

lines.gurmukhi: KwxI bwxI jug cwir lK caurwsIh jUin aupweI
lines.transliteration_english: Khaanee Baanee Jougi Chaari Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Oupaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Four ages, four mines of life, four speeches (para, pasyanti, madhyama and vaikhari) and creatures living in lacs of species

lines.gurmukhi: auqm jUin vKwxIAY mwns jUin dulMB idKweI
lines.transliteration_english: Outam Jooni Vakhaaneeai Maanasi Jooni Dulabh Dikhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has created. Human species known to be a rare one is the best of ail the species.

lines.gurmukhi: sB jUnI kir vs iqsu mwxs no idqI vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhi Jooni Kari Vasi Tisu Maanasi No Ditee Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Making all the species subordinate to human species, the Lord has given it superiority.

lines.gurmukhi: bhuqy mwxs jgq ivic prwDIn ikCu smJ n pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bahoutay Maanas Jagat Vichi Paraadheen Kichhu Samajhi N Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Most of the human beings in the world remain subordinated to each other and are unable to understand anything.

lines.gurmukhi: iqn mY so AwDIn jo mMdI kMmI jnmu gvweI
lines.transliteration_english: Tin Mai So Aadheen Ko Mandee Kanmeen Janamu Gavaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among them, those are real slaves who have lost their lives in evil deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgq dy vuiTAwN lK carwsI Pyir imtweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Day Voutdiaan Lakh Chauraaseeh Dhayri Mitaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The transmigration in the eighty four lac species of life is ended if the holy congregation is pleased.

lines.gurmukhi: guru sbdI vfI vifAweI ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sabadee Vadee Vadiaaee ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Real excellence is achieved by cultivating the Guru's word.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 gwfI rwh in`q kiRXw

Shabad OS B.translation: The highway - daily conduct of the gurmukh  (

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK Blky auT kir AMmiRq vyly sru nHwvMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Bhalakay Outd Kari Anmrit Vaylay Saru Nhaavandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh getting up in arobrosial hours of the early morning takes bath in the sacred tank.

lines.gurmukhi: guru kY bcn aucwir kY DRmswlw dI suriq krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Kai Bachan Ouchaari Kai Dharamasaal Dee Surati Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Reciting the holy hymns of the Guru, he moves towards gurudvara, the central place for Sikh.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivic jwie kY gurbwxI dy pRIiq suxMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Vichi Jaai Kai Gurabaanee Day Preeti Sounandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: There, joining the holy congregation,he lovingly listens to Gurbant, the holy hymns of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: sMkw mnhuN imtwie kY guru isKwN dI syv krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Sankaa Manahu Mitaai Kai Guru Sikhaan Dee Sayv Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Effacing all doubt from his mind he serves the Sikhs of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: ikrq ivrq kir Drmu dI lY prswd Awix vrqMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Kirat Virat Kari Dharamu Dee Lai Parasaad Aani Varatandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then by righteous means he earns his livelihood and he distributes the hard-earned meal among the needy ones.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKwN no dyie kir ipCoN bicAw Awp KvMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhaan No Dayi Kari Pichhon Bachiaa Aapu Khavandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Offering first, to the Sikhs of Guru, the remainder he himself eats.

lines.gurmukhi: klI kwl prgws kir guru cylw cylw guru sMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Kalee Kaal Paragaas Kari Guru Chaylaa Guru Sandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this dark age, illumined by such feelings, the disciple becomes Guru and the Guru disciple.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK gwfI rwhu clMdw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukh Gaadee Raahu Chaladaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs tread on such a highway (of religious life).

lines.gurmukhi: 12 gur AwgXw ivc lIn

Shabad OS B.translation: Absorbed in the will of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwr ijsu siqgur purKu isrMdw soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaar Akaaru Jisu Satiguru Purakhu Sirandaa Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Oankar whose form is the true Guru, is the true creator of universe.

lines.gurmukhi: iek kvwau pswau ijs sbd suriq siqsMg ivloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Jis Sabad Surati Satisang Viloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From His one word the whole creation spreads, and in the holy congregation, the consciousness is merged in His word.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmw ibsnu mhysu imil ds Avqwr vIcwr n hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Mili Das Avataar Veechaar N Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even Brahma Visnu Mahes'a and the ten incarnations jointly, cannot ponder upon His mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: Byd n byd kqyb no ihMdU muslmwx jxoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhayd N Bayd Katayb No Hindoo Mousalamaan Janoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Vedas, Katebas, Hindus, Muslims - none knows His secrets.

lines.gurmukhi: aUqm jnm skwrQw crx srx siqguru ivrloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Outam Janamu Sakaaradaa Charani Sarani Satiguru Viraloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare is a person who comes to the shelter of the feet of the true Guru and makes his life fruitful.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isK suix guruisK hoie murdw hoie murId su koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikh Souni Gurousikh Hoi Muradaa Hoi Mureed Su Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare is a person who listening to the teachings of Guru becomes disciple, remains dead to passions, and prepares himself to be a true servant.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru goirsqwn smoeI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Gorisataan Samoee ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare one absorbs himself in graveyard (i.e. permanent haven) of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 gurisK suB swDk qoN vfy hn

Shabad OS B.translation: All except the Sikhs of the Guru are wandering in delusions

lines.gurmukhi: jp qp hT ingH Gxy caudh ividAw vyd vKwxy
lines.transliteration_english: Jap Tap Hatdi Nigrah Ghanay Chaudah Vidiaa Vayd Vakhaanay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Recitations, austerities, persistences, many renunciaitions explanations on Vedas and all the fourteen skills are known in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: syK nwg snwkwidkw loms AMq AnMq n jwxy
lines.transliteration_english: Saykh Naag Sanakaadikaan Lomas Antu Anat N Jaanay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even Sesanag, Sanaks, and rishi Lomas do not know the mystery of that infinite.

lines.gurmukhi: jqI sqI sMqoKIAw isD nwQ huie nwQ Bulwxy
lines.transliteration_english: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Hoi Naad Bhulaanay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Celebates, follower of truth, contented ones, siddhs, naths(yogis) all becoming master­less are wandering in delusions.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr pYkMbr AaulIey bujrkvwr hjwr hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Paikanbar Auleeay Bujarakavaar Hajaar Hairaanay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Searching Him all the pars, prophets, auliyas and thousands of old men are wonderstruck (because they could not know Him).

lines.gurmukhi: jog Bog lK rog sog lK sMjog ivjog ivfwxy
lines.transliteration_english: Jog Bhog Lakh Rog Sog Lakh Sanjog Vijog Vidaanay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Yogas (austerties), bhogs (joys), lacs of ailments, sufferings and sepa­rations, all are illusions.

lines.gurmukhi: ds nwau sinAwsIAwN BMBl BUsy Kwie Bulwxy
lines.transliteration_english: Das Naaoun Sanniaaseeaan Bhanbhal Bhoosay Khaai Bhulaanay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ten sects of sannyasis are wandering in delusions.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isK jogI jwgdy hor sBy bnvws lukwxy
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikh Jogee Jaagaday Hor Sabhay Banavaasu Loukaanay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Disciple yogis of the Guru always remain alert whereas others have hidden themselves in the jungles, i.e. they are unconcerned with the problems of the world.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil nwm vKwxy ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Mili Naamu Vakhaanay ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Joining the holy congregation, the Sikhs of the Guru eulogize the glory of the name of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 siqgurU isKXw

Shabad OS B.translation: Teachings of the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: cMd sUrj lK cwnxy iql n pujin siqguru mqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chand Sooraj Lakh Chaananay Til N Pujani Satiguru Matee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The light of lacs of moons and suns cannot become equal to an iota of the wisdom of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: lK pwqwl Akws lK aucI nIvI ikrx n rqI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Paataal Akaas Lakh Ouchee Neeveen Kirani N Ratee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of nether worlds and millions of skies exist but there is not the slightest maladjustment in their alignment.

lines.gurmukhi: lK pwxI lK paux imil rMg ibrMg qrMgn vqI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Paanee Lakh Paoun Mili Rang Birang Tarang N Vatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of airs and waters join to create moving waves of different hues.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid n AMq n mD plu lK prlau lK lK auqpqI
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi N Antu N Mantu Palu Lakh Paralau Lakh Lakh Outapatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of creations and millions of dissolutions continuously alternate without the beginning, middle and end of the process.

lines.gurmukhi: DIrj Drm n pujnI lK lK prbq lK DrqI
lines.transliteration_english: Dheeraj Dharam N Pujanee Lakh Lakh Parabat Lakh Dharatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of forbearing earths and mountains cannot equate the teachings of the true Guru in perseverance and righteousness.

lines.gurmukhi: lK igAwn iDAwn lK quil n qulIAY iql gurmqI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Tuli N Tuleeai Til Guramatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions types of knowledges and meditations are not equal to even a particle of the knowledge of the wisdom of Guru (gunnat).

lines.gurmukhi: ismrx ikrix GxIN Gol GqI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Simaran Kirani Ghanee Ghol Ghatee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: I have sacrified Lacs of rays of lights for one ray of the meditation upon the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 ivrly bMdy

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare servants

lines.gurmukhi: lK drIAwau kvwau ivic lK lK lihr qrMg auTMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dareeaau Kavaau Vichi Lakh Lakh Lahari Tarang Outdaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the one word of the Lord lacs of rivers (of life) flow and lacs of waves come up in them.

lines.gurmukhi: ieks lhr qrMg ivic lK lK drIAwau vhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Ikas Lahari Tarang Vichi Lakh Lakh Lakh Dareeaau Vahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In His one wave again, lacs of rivers (of life) flow.

lines.gurmukhi: ieks ieks drIAwau ivic lK Avqwr Akwr iPrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Ikas Ikas Dareeaau Vichi Lakh Avataar Akaar Dhiranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In each river, in the form of incarnations, lacs of jivs assuming many forms are roaming about.

lines.gurmukhi: mC kC mirjIvVy Agm AQwh n Qwh lhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Machh Kachh Marijeevarhay Agam Adaah N Haadi Lahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Incarnations in the form of fish and tortoise dive into it but they cannot fathom its depth, i.e. they cannot know the limits of that supreme reality.

lines.gurmukhi: prvdgwr Apwr hY pwrwvwr n lihr qrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Paravadagaar Apaaru Hai Paaraavaar N Lahani Taranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: That sustainer Lord is beyond all limits; none can know the bounds of his waves.

lines.gurmukhi: Ajrwvr siqguru purKu gurmiq guruisK Ajr jrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Ajaraavaru Satiguru Purakhu Guramati Guru Sikh Ajaru Jaranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: That true Guru is the excellent purus and the disciples of the Guru bear the unbearable, through the wisdom of the Guru (gurmat).

lines.gurmukhi: krn bMdgI ivrly bMdy ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Karani Bandagee Viralay Banday ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare are the people who undertake such devotional worship.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 Awid purK

Shabad OS B.translation: Primeval Lord

lines.gurmukhi: iek kvwau Amwau ijs kyvfu vfy dI vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Kavaau Amaau Jisu Kayvadu Vaday Dee Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: What could be said about the greatness of that great Lord whose one word is beyond all measures.

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwr ijsu iqsu dw AMqu n koaU pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaar Akaar Jisu Tisu Daa Antu N Kooo Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: None can know His mystery whose base is only One Gallia". How could His long life be counted whose half a breath is unfathom­able.

lines.gurmukhi: ADw swhu AQwhu ijsu vfI Awrjw gxq n AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Adhaa Saahu Adaahu Jisu Vadee Aarajaa Ganat N Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His creation cannot be evaluated; how can then that imperceptible one be beholden (understood).

lines.gurmukhi: kudriq kIm n jwxIAY kwdru AlKu n liKAw jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kudarati Keem N Jaaneeai Kaadaru Alakhu N Lakhiaa Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His gifts such as days and nights are also invalu­able and His other boons are also infinite.

lines.gurmukhi: dwiq n kIm n rwiq idhu bysumwr dwqwru KudweI
lines.transliteration_english: Daati N Keem N Raati Dihu Baysoumaaru Daataaru Khudaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Indescribable is the position of the Lord, the master of the masterless,

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq AnwQ nwQ AkQ kQw nyiq nyiq AlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Gati Anaad Naad Akad Kadaa Nayti Nayti Alaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And His unnarratable story can only be concluded by saying neti neti (this is not, this not).

lines.gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdysu krweI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Karaaee ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Worthy of salutation is only that primeval Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 krm inKyD

Shabad OS B.translation: Condemnation of worthless actions

lines.gurmukhi: 18 suK Pl ivSyKqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Condemnation of worthless actions

lines.gurmukhi: isr klvqu lY lK vwr homy kit kit iqlu iqlu dyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Siru Kalavatu Lai Lakh Vaar Homay Kati Kati Tilu Tilu Dayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a saw is held one's head and the body is cut piece by piece to be put as burnt offerings;

lines.gurmukhi: glY ihmwcl lK vwir krY aurD qp jugiq snyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Galai Himaachal Lakh Vaari Karai Uradh Tap Jougati Sanayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If lacs of times one gets decayed in snow or adopting proper techniques one undertakes penances with body upside down;

lines.gurmukhi: jl qp swDY Agin qp ArD qwp kir hoie ivdyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Tapu Saadhay Agani Tapu Pooar Tapu Kari Hoi Vidayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one becomes bodyless through water penances, fire-penances, and internal fire-penances;

lines.gurmukhi: vrq nym sMjm Gxy dyvI dyv AsQwn BvyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Varat Naym Sanjam Ghanay Dayvee Dayv Asadaan Bhavayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one practises fasts, rules, disciplines and wanders about the places of gods and goddesses;

lines.gurmukhi: puMn dwn cMigAweIAwN isDwsx isMGwsx byhI
lines.transliteration_english: Pounn Daan Changiaaeeaan Sidhaasan Singhaasan Day Ayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one makes throne of virtuous charities, goodness and lotus postures and sits on it;

lines.gurmukhi: invlI krm BuieAMgmw pUrk kuMBk ryc kryhI
lines.transliteration_english: Nivalee Karam Bhuiangamaan Poorak Kounbhak Raych Karayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one practises nioli karma, serpent posture, exhalation, inhalation and suspension of vital air (pranayam);

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl sr n sByhI ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Sarani Sabhayhee ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: All these to­gether are not equal to the fruit of delight attained by the gurmukh.

lines.gurmukhi: shs isAwxy sY purs shs isAwxp lieAw n jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Siaanay Saipuras Sahas Siaanap Laiaa N Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of wisemen through their skills cannot attain the (supreme) fruit of delight.

lines.gurmukhi: shs suGV suGVweIAwN qulu n shs cqur cqurweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Sougharh Sougharhaaeeaan Tulu N Sahas Chatur Chaturaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of skillful persons with their skills and thousands of clever persons with their cleverness cannot attain Him.

lines.gurmukhi: lK hkIm lK ihkmqI dunIAwNdwr vfy duinAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Hakeem Lakh Hikamatee Douneeaadaar Vaday Douniaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of physicians, lacs of ingenious persons and other worldly wise people;

lines.gurmukhi: lK swh piqswh lK lK vjIr n mslq kweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Saah Patisaah Lakh Lakh Vajeer N Masalat Kaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of kings, emperors and of their minister in lacs are there but no suggestion of anybody is of any use.

lines.gurmukhi: jqI sqI sMqoKIAw isD nwQ imil hwQ n pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Mili Haad N Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Celebates, truthful and contented ones, siddhs, naths, none could lay his hand upon Him.

lines.gurmukhi: cwr vrn cwr mjhbw iCA drsn nihN AlKu lKweI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaar Varan Chaar Majahabaan Chhia Darasan Nahi Alakhu Lakhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: None, including four varnas, four sects and six philoso­phies could behold that imperceptible Lord's fruit of delight.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl vfI vifAweI ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Vadee Vadiaaee ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Great is the glory of the fruit of delight of the gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 pIr murIdI

Shabad OS B.translation: Master and discipleship

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdI gwKVI pIrwN pIru gurwN guru jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedee Gaakharhee Peeraan Peeru Guraan Guru Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Discipleship of the Guru is a difficult task; any pir or Guru of the Gurus knows it.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru dw aupdysu lY vIh iekIh aulMiG is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Daa Oupadaysu Lai Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Accepting the teachings of the true Guru and going beyond the wordly illusions He identifies that Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: murdw hoie murId so guru isK jwie smwie bbwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Muradaa Hoi Mureed So Guru Sikh Jaai Samaai Babaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only that Sikh of the Guru absorbs his self into Baba (Nanak) who has become dead to his carnal desires.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrIN pY pwKwk hoie iqsu pwKwk pwku pqIAwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Paireen Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Tisu Paa Khaak Paaku Pateeaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fall­ing at the Guru's feet he becomes the dust of his feet; people consider such dust of the feet of a humble Sikh as sacred.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQ AgMmu hY mir mir jIvY jwie pCwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Aganmu Hai Mari Mari Jeevai Jaai Pachhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Unapproachable is the way of gurmukhs; while being dead they remain alive (i.e. they make only their desires dead), and ultimately they identify the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: guru aupdys Avysu kir kIVI BiRMgI vwNg vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Keerhee Bhringee Vaang Vidaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Inspired by the teach­ings of the Guru and adopting the conduct of bhritigi insect (which trans­forms small ant into bhringt), he (the disciple) attains the grandeur and great­ness of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw kaux AwiK vKwxY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Kaoun Aakhi Vakhaanai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Who, in fact, can describe this ineffable story?

lines.gurmukhi: 20 suK Pl

Shabad OS B.translation: Fruit of delight

lines.gurmukhi: cwr vrn imil swDsMg cwr cvkw solih jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varani Mili Saadhasangi Chaar Chavakaa Solahi Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: After coming to holy congregation all the four varnas (castes) become four time more powerful i.e. they become perfect sixteen types of skills in them,

lines.gurmukhi: pMj sbd gur sbd ilv pMjU pMjy pMjIh lwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Panj Sabad Gur Sabad Liv Panjoo Panjay Panjeeh Laanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Absorbing consciousness in five qualities of word (pares, pa(yantl, madhyama, vaikharf and matrika), the jilt tames all the five times five, 1.e. twenty-five proclivities of human nature.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA drsx iek drsxo iCA Cky CqIh smwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Darasan Ik Darasano Chhia Chhakay Chhateeh Samaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Subsuming six philosophies In the one philosophy of the Lord, thejtv comes to know about the significance of six times six, i.e. thirty six postures (of yoga).

lines.gurmukhi: sq dIp iek dIpko sq sqy auxvMjih BwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Deep Ik Deepako Sat Satay Ounavanjahi Bhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Beholding the light of one lamp in all the seven continents, forty nine (7x7) airs are controlled by fit),

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwq ieku Dwq kir ATU ATy cauhT mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaat Kari Atdoo Atday Chauhatd Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The delight of sixty four skills is enjoyed when the asr dhatu in the form of four varnas and four ashrams associated with philosopher's stone in the form of (one) Guru is transformed into gold.

lines.gurmukhi: nau nwQ iek nwQ hY nauN nweyN eykwsIh dwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Naoun Naad Ik Naad Hai Naoun Naaayn Aykaaseeh Daanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: By bowing before one master of the nine naths (masters), the knowledge about the eighty-one divisions (of cosmos) is attained.

lines.gurmukhi: ds duAwr inrDwr kir dwho dwhy sau prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Das Duaar Niradhaar Kari Daaho Daahay Sau Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting freedom from the ten doors (of body) the perfect yogi gets cent percent accepted (in the court of Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl coj ivfwxY ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Choj Vidaanai ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs' fruit of delight possesses a subtle mystique.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 siqgur mihmw

Shabad OS B.translation: Praises of the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: sO ivc vrqy isK sMq iekoqr sO siqgur AibnwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Sau Vich Varatai Sikh Sant Ikotar Sau Satigur Abinaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the Sikh is hundred times, the eternal true Guru is hundred and one times.

lines.gurmukhi: sdw sdIv dIbwx ijs AsiQr sdw n AwvY jwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Sadaa Sadeev Deevaan Jisu Asadir Sadaa N Aavai Jaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His court is ever steadfast and he never undergoes the cycle of transmigra­tion.

lines.gurmukhi: iek mn ijnHYN iDAwieAw kwtI glhu iqsY jm PwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Man Jinhain Dhiaaiaa Kaatee Galahu Tisai Jam Dhaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who meditates upon Him with singleminded devotion, gets his noose of Yama, cut asunder.

lines.gurmukhi: ieko iek vrqdw sbd suriq siqgurU jxwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Iko Ik Varatadaa Sabad Surati Satiguroo Janaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: That one Lord alone pervades everywhere, and only by merging consciousness in the word that true Guru can be known.

lines.gurmukhi: ibn drsnu guru mUrqo BRmiq iPry lK jUn caurwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Darasanu Guru Moorati Bhramataa Dhiray Lakh Jooni Chauraasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the glimpse of the manifest Guru (the word of Guru), thefts, wanders in eightyfour lacs of species of life.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu dIiKAw gurdyv dI mir jnmy ivic nrk pvwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Deekhiaa Guradayv Dee Mari Janamay Vichi Narak Pavaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the teachings of Guru, the jivgoes on taking birth and dying and is ultimately thrown in hell.

lines.gurmukhi: inrgux srgux siqgurU ivrlw ko gur sbd smwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Niragoun Saragoun Satiguroo Viralaa Ko Gur Sabad Samaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru (Lord) is without attributes and yet possesses all the qualities.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu guru Et n horu ko scI Et n kdy ibnwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Guru Aot N Horu Ko Sachee Aot N Kaday Binaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A rare one absorbes himself in the word of the Guru. There is no shelter without Guru's and this true refuge never gets destroyed.

lines.gurmukhi: gurwN gurU siqguru purKu Awid AMiq iQru gurU rhwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Guraan Guroo Satiguru Purakhu Aadi Anti Diru Guroo Rahaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru (Lord), Guru of all Gurus, is the immutable Guru from beginning to end.

lines.gurmukhi: ko ivrlw gurmuiK shij smwsI ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Ko Viralaa Guramoukhi Sahaji Samaasee ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare gurmukh gets merged in the equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: 22 mUl vrxn

Shabad OS B.translation: Basic description

lines.gurmukhi: iDAwn mUl mUrq gurU pUjw mUl guru crx pujwey
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiaan Mool Moorati Guroo Poojaa Mool Guru Charan Pujaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Basis of meditation is the form of Gum (who is with qualities as well as beyond all qualities) and basic worship is worship of the feet of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: mMqR mUl guru vwk hY scu sbdu siqgurU suxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Mantr Moolu Guru Vaak Hai Sachu Sabadu Satiguroo Sounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Basis of the mantras is the word of the Guru and the true Guru recites the true word.

lines.gurmukhi: crxodku pivqR hY crx kml guru isK DuAwey
lines.transliteration_english: Charanodaku Pavitr Hai Charan Kamal Guru Sikh Dhuaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wash of the feet of Guru is sacred and the Sikhs wash the lotus feet (of the Guru).

lines.gurmukhi: crxwNmiRq ksml kty guru DUrI bury lyK imtwey
lines.transliteration_english: Charanaamrit Kasamal Katay Guru Dhooree Buray Laykh Mitaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nectar of the feet of Guru cuts asunder all sins and the dust of the Guru's feet erases all evil writs.

lines.gurmukhi: siqnwmu krqw purKu vwihgurU ivic irdY smwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Naamu Karataa Purakhu Vaahiguroo Vichi Ridai Samaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: By its grace the true named creator Lord, Vahiguru, comes to reside in the heart.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh iqlk imtwie kir gurmuK iqlk nIswx cVHwey
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Tilak Mitaaikay Guramoukhi Tilak Neesaan Charhhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Effacing the twelve marks of the yogis, the gurmukh puts on his forehead the mark of the grace of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: rhurwsI rhurwis eyhu ieko jpIAY horu qjwey
lines.transliteration_english: Rahuraasee Rahuraasi Ayhu Iko Japeeai Horu Tajaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out of all religious conducts, only one code of conduct is true that repudiat­ing all, one should go on remembering the one Lord alone.

lines.gurmukhi: ibn gur drsx dyKxw BRmqw iPry Taur nhI pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Gur Darasanu Daykhanaa Bhramataa Dhiray Tdaurhi Naheen Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Following any one other than the Guru, man goes on wandering without any shelter.

lines.gurmukhi: ibn guru pUry Awey jwey ]22]40]
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Guru Poorai Aaay Jaaay ?22?40?chaaleeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: De­void of the perfect Guru, jiv goes on suffering transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: sINcq sill bhu brn bnwspqI cMdn subws eykY cMdn bKwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Seenchat Salil Bahu Baran Banaasapatee , Chandan Soubaas Aykai Chandan Bakhaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By irrigation, several kinds of plants and vegetation can be grown but when they come in touch with sandalwood they are all called sandalwood (because they have the same fragrance).

lines.gurmukhi: prbq ibKY auqpq huie Ast Dwq pwrs pris eykY kMcn kY jwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Parabat Bikhai Outapat Hui Asat Dhaata , Paaras Parasi Aykai Kanchan Kai Jaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Eight metals are obtained from mountain but when each one of them are touched by philosopher-stone become gold.

lines.gurmukhi: ins AMDkwr qwrw mMfl cmqkwr idn idnkr joiq eykY prvwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Nis Andhakaar Taaraa Mandal Chamatakaara , Din Dinakar Joti Aykai Paravaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the darkness of the night, many stars shine but during the day, the light of one Sun alone is considered authentic.

lines.gurmukhi: logn mY logwcwr gurmuiK eykMkwr sbd suriq aunmn aunmwnIAY ]40]
lines.transliteration_english: Logan Mai Logaachaar Gurmukhi Aykankaara , Sabad Surati Ounaman Ounamaaneeai ?40?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly a Sikh who lives life according to the advice of his Guru becomes divine in all respects, even when he is living life as a worldly person. Due to the lodging of the divine word in his mind, he is known to be living in heavenly state. (40)
